name: Lemon Lentil Soup
description: This gorgeous Lemon Lentil Soup features bright lemony flavors, creamy red lentils and plenty of fresh vegetables. It's a naturally vegan and gluten free soup that everyone will enjoy!
recipeIngredient: 3 large carrots, peeled and diced or sliced into rounds
3 cups baby spinach or chopped kale, optional
1/4 cup fresh parsley, optional for garnish
tiny pinch pinch cayenne pepper, optional for heat

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onions, garlic, carrots and celery. Sauté, stirring frequently for about 5-6 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onions, garlic, carrots and celery. Sauté, stirring frequently for about 5-6 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the red lentils, broth, cumin, coriander and turmeric and stir to combine. Bring to a boil, then lower heat to a simmer for 30 minutes, until the lentils are soft.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the red lentils, broth, cumin, coriander and turmeric and stir to combine. Bring to a boil, then lower heat to a simmer for 30 minutes, until the lentils are soft.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the cashews and lemon juice in a high powered blender, along with 2 cups of the soup. Blend on high until creamy and smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the cashews and lemon juice in a high powered blender, along with 2 cups of the soup. Blend on high until creamy and smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the creamy blended mixture back to the pot and stir in the spinach/kale, if using. Cook for a few minutes until kale has softened, if using.  If you want a thinner soup, add 1/2-1 cup of water or more broth.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the creamy blended mixture back to the pot and stir in the spinach/kale, if using. Cook for a few minutes until kale has softened, if using.  If you want a thinner soup, add 1/2-1 cup of water or more broth.

recipeInstructions.text: Taste and add salt/pepper and cayenne pepper. Serve immediately and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Taste and add salt/pepper and cayenne pepper. Serve immediately and enjoy!

recipeInstructions.text: Leftover soup will keep for 4-5 days in the refrigerator, and can also be frozen. It does thicken as it sits, so add a little water or broth when you reheat it. It's also good served with a scoop of rice.
